channel.title: Can't edit Client.Java?
channel.description:
For some reason i can't edit [code] Client.Java [/code] But i can still edit npcdrops,autospawn,item.java and other stuff. When i do the same save,compile,run ruitine it doesnt work...
This is my compiler code
[code]@echo off COLOR 08 title Project Emo "C:\Program Files\Java\[Your type of jdk]\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/code]
SOURCE: DEVOLUTION (EDITED DOIDAN)

item.title: Can't edit Client.Java?
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

This is the best one in my opinion.

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

I didn’t have to set my jdk version or set my variables for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't edit Client.Java?
item.dc:creator: @n00bf0rlyf3 n00bf0rlyf3
item.description:
@n00bf0rlyf3 wrote:

ikram, i tried to use your compiler because i have same jdk version but when i compile something in client.java it doesnt show up ingame
like if i change what it says when u log in at the bottom…

Read full topic

item.title: Can't edit Client.Java?
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

What ever JDk version you donwloaded put in E.G.

@echo off COLOR 08 title SERVER NAME HERE "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Here, my JDK version is jdk1.6.0_13

Read full topic

item.title: Can't edit Client.Java?
item.dc:creator: @n00bf0rlyf3 n00bf0rlyf3
item.description:
@n00bf0rlyf3 wrote:

How do i put my java into the code to put it there?

Read full topic

item.title: Can't edit Client.Java?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Replace ‘[Your type of jdk]’ with your JDK version.

Read full topic
